net.homeip.donaldm.httpdbase4j
Class FileRequest

java.lang.Object
  net.homeip.donaldm.httpdbase4j.Request
      net.homeip.donaldm.httpdbase4j.FileRequest
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, DirItemInterface
public class FileRequest
extends Request
implements DirItemInterface, java.lang.Cloneable

Encapsulates an HTTP request for a resource in a local file system

Author:
Donald Munro
See Also:
Request

FileRequest

public FileRequest(FileRequest request,
                   java.lang.String fileName)
            throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException,
                   java.io.IOException,
                   java.net.URISyntaxException
Copy constructs a FileRequest with a new file. If defaultFileName is not null then assumes that request is a directory.

Parameters:
request - The FileRequest instance to copy
fileName - The new file for the request.

Parameters:

getDirListFiles

public java.util.TreeSet<DirItemInterface> getDirListFiles(DirItemInterface.SORTBY sortBy)
Description copied from class: Request
Return a list of files in a resource directory.

Specified by:
getDirListFiles in class Request
Parameters:
sortBy - Specify how the files should be sorted. This is an instance of DirItemInterface.SORTBY ie NAME, DATE or SIZE).
Returns:
A TreeSet (sortable set) of DirItemInterface implementing instances. Returns null if the resource is not a directory.

getStream

public java.io.InputStream getStream(boolean isEncoded)
Description copied from class: Request
Return a stream of the resource contents.

Specified by:
getStream in class Request
Parameters:
isEncoded - If true will return a stream for the encoded (eg gzip or deflate) resource or if cacheing is allowed for this request and the encoded resource is in the cache then a stream for the cached version. If false returns a stream for the unencoded resource. If there is no encoding ie the client does not support encoding then both true and false return a stream for the unencoded resource.
Returns:
A stream of the resource contents.

getStream

public java.io.InputStream getStream()
Specified by:
getStream in interface DirItemInterface
Overrides:
getStream in class Request
Returns:
A stream of the resource contents (encoded content is returned if available).
